Name: Space Battle
Description:
Battleship version on hexgrid with spaceships.

Each player deploys his spaceships secretly on a hex grid. Then each player shoots at the other's grid by calling a location. The defender responds by "Hit!" or "Miss!". You try to deduce where the enemy ships are and sink them. First to do so wins.
Families: Series: Travel Games for Smart Kids (Goldmerk)

Name: Nugget
Description:
Nugget is a card game about building the best poker hand.

Played over multiple rounds. Each round, the deck is shuffled and each player is dealt one card. The rest of the cards are placed in the middle of the table in a face down stack. On a turn, a player draws either the top card from the deck or a card from the center (if any). When they draw a card from the deck, they may keep it or they may discard it to the center of the table. If they discard it, they must draw another card from the deck, which they must keep. This occurs until everyone has seven cards in hand. From those seven cards, each player builds their best five-card poker hand and is awarded points based on the strength of that poker hand. Whoever has the most points after multiple rounds wins.

Nugget is in the same family as Sacramento and Bonanza.

Played with a standard deck of cards, published in Reiner Knizia's book Blazing Aces!: A Fistful of Family Card Games.

Name: Blind Wizard Brawl
Description:
Blind Wizard Brawl is phygital card game by Wrench Games. 
It's a mini deck building dueling game where players combat to become the most powerful wizards in the land.
Combining classic cards and a digital app, blind Wizard Brawl combines the classic table top staple with the modern convenience of an app.

In a world where magic is the key to all life, wizards are gods. You play as one of the most powerful wizards in the land, however, all power comes at a cost. The magic has taken your sight, leaving you only aware of your own power and the magic you possess. 
Using your limited perception of the world, you must use your skills in magic to absorb and unleash magic upon your enemies to become the one true wizard.

How to play:
Each Player has their own private app on their device.
Generate a Wizard on your app. In private.
Separate the cars into three separate stack, one for each type of card: Wave, Growth, and Blaze.
All players take one card from each of these stacks to create their starting deck of three cards. Shuffle your new deck and draw a starting had of two cards.
The game starts with whoever has the worst eyesight or the most magical powers. You decide which.
On each of your turns, you do one of two things:
Do some Wizard Magic (Chant, Cast, or Mind Blast)
Then, draw a card from your deck.
Now, end your turn and play proceeds clockwise.
Any player who dies announces their defeat.
PLAY CONTINUES UNTIL ONLY ONE WIZARD REMAINS.
TO WIN, YOU MUST BE THIS WIZARD, THE GREATEST WIZARD!

Name: Wer will schwarzer Peter werden?
Description:
Schwarzer Peter or Black Peter is the anti-Santa Claus, a character who comes along and punishes the "bad" kids while Santa doles out presents to the ones who've been good. This 19th Century gambling game uses Black Peter as a theme for a roll-and-move race with particularly nasty penalty spaces.

The board has a 70-space track, with 28 square spaces around the edge of the board, and then two concentric rings of spaces (large and illustrated 33-44, small colored spaces 45-68) with 69 and 70 along with Black Peter in the center.

The game can be played by any number and uses two dice. Anyone who rolls double 1 or 2 gets to roll again. There is an initial ante, and various spaces call for fines to be paid or bonuses received, either to/from the pot or other players. Spaces 12, 21, 25 and 28 make players go back to 5.

Anyone who lands on 35 must take the Black Peter token and is out of the game, while other spaces give players a black token - and three black tokens also eliminate the player. Any player that runs out of money along the way is eliminated too. First player to 70 collects the pot.

Name: Tarabish
Description:
Tarabish, also known by its slang term Bish, is a trick-taking card game of complex rules derived from Belote, a game of the Jass family. The actual pronunciation of the name is "tar-bish", even though it can be spelled "tarabish". It is played primarily by the people of Cape Breton, Nova Scotia, in Canada, where it was brought in 1901 by a Lebanese immigrant George Shebib.

The game is over when one or both teams accumulate 500 points or more. Points are counted at the end of each hand and both teams always count their points. The team with the most points at the end of the game wins.

A Tarabish deck consists of a normal deck of playing cards with the 2 through 5 of each suit removed. In preparation for the hand the dealer shuffles the cards in the usual manner. When finished the person to the right of the dealer cuts the cards. The cut must leave at least four cards in each portion of the deck. Once the cards have been cut, no further shuffling is allowed.

The 36 Tarabish cards are dealt in groups of three beginning to the left of the dealer and proceeding clockwise until all the cards are passed out. The four players look at their first six cards; the last three, called the kitty, remain face down until after the bid is complete and a trump suit has been chosen.

Cards value
The cards have a strict point value in trumps:

J = 20 points
9 = 14 points
A = 11 points
10 = 10 points
K = 4 point
Q = 3 point
8 7 6 = no value
The order and value in a non-trump suit are:

A = 11 points
10 = 10 points
K = 4 points
Q = 3 points
J = 2 points
9 8 7 6 = no value

Name: Lewt Ninja
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Lewt Ninja is a standalone card game that challenges 2 - 5 players to become Epic Fantasy Heroes and find treasure, weapons, armour, and Artifacts from the many monsters they encounter. But beware! Every Hero is out only for themselves and will try to swindle the winnings away from you and the rest of your group. Build your lootstash and take what is yours and theirs before they do. Are you ambitious enough to be the Lewt Ninja!

The game Lewt Ninja includes

1 Monster Deck – The monster deck consists of 40 unique monsters and Boss monsters, players draw monster cards during the beginning of their turn. Each monster card will direct players to draw loot cards or additional monster cards. Some monster cards will have special rules that will effect players and prevent different player actions from being used during the round

1 Loot Deck – The loot deck consists of 58 treasure, weapons, and armor cards. Players will find their heroes armor sets and legendary weapons along with other many treasures needed to collect in order to win the game.

1 Player Deck – The Player deck consists of 81 action cards; inside players will find Roll cards used to bid on the loot dropped by monsters. Roll cards have numeric values that simulate dice rolls, the player with the highest roll wins the treasure being rolled on. Along with the roll cards players will also find System and Player Action cards, these cards are used by players to stop players from rolling on treasure or steal treasure away from other players.

10 Player Mats – The player mats included with Lewt Ninja are 10 different heroes that players will assume the role of during game.  Players can play as either a Mystic, Wizard, Holy Monk, Ranger, or Shield Knight. There are 2 versions of each hero that allow players to play as same class during gameplay.  Each of the classes have special abilities that can be unlocked by obtaining their heroes magic armor. These abilities can be used by a player when they begin the round

To play Lewt Ninja have each player pick one of the hero class characters. Once everyone has picked a hero remove any armor set cards from the loot deck for any hero classes not in the game. Shuffle the 3 decks and place them in the center of the play area; deal out seven player action cards to all players and choose the player turn order.

Lewt Ninja has 3 phases of game play. 
At the beginning of the round players will draw one monster from the Monster Deck, this is called Pulling a monster. After pulling the monster the player read aloud the cards rule to everyone; players will then either draw a Loot Card or additional monster card.

The second phase of the round called Looting; the player who started the round will draw the number of Loot cards indicated on the card. Players will then play their Roll cards for the treasure dropped by the monster. If more than one loot card has been drawn players will roll only on one item at a time. Roll cards are placed face down and only revealed once everyone has played a card. The player with the highest roll card wins the treasure.

Phase three, the Ninja phase is final phase of the round. During this phase players can play any of the System or Player Action cards to steal away treasure or protect treasure they have won during the round. Some System and Player Action cards can be played at any time allowing player to block other players from rolling during the looting phase or other actions like visit the traveling merchant to buy treasure by selling back won treasure to the loot deck.

Once the round has been completed all players will draw a new card from the player deck and move to the next player in the turn order.

To win the game players must collect all 8 pieces of their armor, winning all a pieces is an automatic win the game. Should a hero lose any pieces of the armor to another player they still have a chance to win. Players will then need to steel away armor from other players and collect all of the loot cards they can. Once the final loot card has been one the player who has the most loot is the winner.

Lewt Ninja also has two other game modes

Legendary Mode: 
In this mode of the game Players will not only need to win their 8 armor piece set but will need to also win their classes legendary weapon.

Vote to Kick 
Remove all of the all non-set loot from the Loot Deck. The object of Vote to Kick is to eliminate players from the game by stealing their Armor Set pieces. A Player is eliminated from the game when another player owns 3 pieces of the other player's class armor.

Name: Der kluge Sparer
Description:
Each player gets an bank account and pocket money. There is also a joint account. Each player has to get from space 1 to space 120 (Raiffeisen symbol). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the players, mostly by gaining or losing money. The first player to reach space 120 gets half of the joint account, the next one half of the rest and so on. The player with the most money wins the game.

The playing money pictures Deutsche Mark banknotes that were first issued 1961 and 1963.

Name: Sugar Rush
Description: Created in response to an almost-four-year-old's request for a board game based on her favourite movie, Sugar Rush is a relatively simple racing game designed for children, based thematically on the fictional video game Sugar Rush, from the Disney movie Wreck-it Ralph. Players assume the role of a racer, setup at the starting line, and then take turns rolling dice for their movement around the race track. Each racer has a unique ability that they can charge-up during the race and then use to their advantage. Racers can also gain Power Ups, which are drawn from a randomized deck of Power Up cards. First across the finish line gets 8 Gold Coins, second place gets 5 Gold coins, and third place gets 2 Gold coins. The racer with the most coins at the end wins.

Name: King Cat
Description:
King Cat is a new board game in which Cat Lovers must attract the Cat inside their home, while Cat Haters must kick him out of the garden.

Bazooka, Mice Cake, Vacuum Blender, Inflatable Cat, Alien Kidnapping, Dark Ritual… are all part of the numerous tricks and powers that players have at their disposal to gain some control over the Cat and win the game.

Trick is, the Cat also has his word to say and can choose to ignore players or take his own action, like refusing to move at all.

Name: Island of Heroes
Description: Island of Heroes is a tactical-level game of Sino-Soviet border conflict in Zhenbao Island, 1969. One player commands People's Liberation Army, another player Soviet border guards.

Name: Jump Wars
Description:
A Space Empire Game for 3-5+ players using simultaneous movement per written orders.

Play is conducted on a 10x10 grid populated at random with counters (30 x void, 20 x star field, 10 x cluster, 20 x black hole, 20 x nebula).  The counters indicate the resources to be gain at that location or restrictions/advantages conveyed by that location.

Each player gets a set of counters of a unique colour, plus one unique counter that designates their homeworld. Players share a common set of resource tokens and a common deck comprising two types of card – basic technologies (of which there are 12 with each player starting at level 1 in each) and special technologies (which do not have levels – players either have them or they don’t).

Each turn has 8 Phases. Within a phase, the start player goes first and play proceeds clockwise.

1. Draw Phase.  
-  Each player draws 2 cards from the Tech Deck.

2. Trade Phase
-  Players may trade/gift Tech cards and resource tokens, as well as make promises and alliances. 
-  The player with the highest trade level may steal a random card from any target opponents hand. 
-  The player with the highest diplomacy level may declare one target player as an ally. The Ally may not jump fleets onto the diplomat’s currently occupied spaces.

3. Tech Phase
-  Each player discards one Tech Card from their Hand and increases their level in that tech by one.  Alternatively, a player may discard one Special Tech Card from their hand and gain that special ability. 
-  Any player then may discard 2 cards of the same type to increase their level in that tech by one.

4. Mine Phase
-  Each player gains Resource Tokens (RT) for star fields, clusters and homeworlds occupied, and for Tech cards discarded.  The RT gained is modified by the manufacturing level of the player.

5. Build Phase
-  Players may buy fleets. A fleet costs 4 plus your attack and defence levels minus your miniaturization level. All fleets start stacked on your homeworld.

6. Jump Phase
-  All movement is simultaneous. All players must write movement (jump) orders which are revealed at the same time. An order moves 1 fleet or a stack of fleets you control from one space to another space. Players must include the start and finish coordinates as well as the number of Fleets jumping in the Jump Order. Jump distance and fleet size is dictated by jump level and logistics level

7. Fight Phase
-  If 2 or more opposing fleets occupy the same space, there will be combat until only one side remains. Attack order is determined by Initiative level and the damage delivered is based on fleet size, attack level and defence level of the opposing fleet.

8. Final Phase
-  Max hand size is 3 + the player’s research level. All players discard excess cards.

Victory is achieved by occupying all opponents’ Homeworlds at the end of the turn.

Name: Kill Hitler
Description:
A card game for 2-4+ players set in the period 1940-45. Players represent various elements of the German Resistance trying to assassinate Hitler.

Through card play players strive to be the first player to assassinate Hitler.

Players share a common deck comprising 6 card types: 
Method (Plot Card. Weapons used in an attempt)
Conspirator (Plot Card. Key Personnel involved)
Venue (Plot Card. Exact Building or Location the Fuhrer is currently in)
Locale (Plot Card. City or Region the Fuhrer is currently in) 
Save (Events that Prevent an assassination)
Action (Events with Special effects)

To set-up the deck is shuffled and each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards. 
 Players take turns with each turn having 5 phases: 
1.  Fate Phase
-   Draw 1 card from the deck and put it in your hand. 
2.  Plot Phase 
-   You may put 1 or more plot cards into play face up in front of you. 
-   A Complete Plot consists of 1 of each of the 4 different types of Plot Cards:  Method, Conspirator, Venue, Locale. 
3.  Foil Phase 
-   Any opponent may play (discard) 1 or more save cards. 
A save card causes the target indicated plot card to be discarded.  You may immediately play a plot card from your hand to replace the card eliminated by the save card. 
4.  Kill Phase
-   If you have complete plot in play, roll 1 die for each of the 4 plot cards. (This is called the assassination attempt). 
For each odd number you roll, discard 1 plot card.  If all the rolls are even, the attempt is a success, you have killed Hitler, and you win the game.  
5.  End Phase 
-   Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards.

If Hitler is not killed after the players have gone through the deck twice then Hitler survives, the German Resistance is crushed, and all the players lose.

Name: Redemption City
Description:
After the apocalypse, the Earth is all but destroyed, save for the last city. The few remaining humans who were neither good enough for Heaven nor evil enough for Hell are stuck in limbo, held on Earth. Angels and Demons wage war against each other across the universe, trying to gain control where they can. They care not for the humans in limbo, for their souls won’t ever be released to them. As the Earth is removed of most humans, nature has decided to take back what is left, to consume the land with their plants once more.

The final Battle for earth begins!


This is a strategy game for 2 - 5 players, where you build your base, gain resources, and send units to build or attack.

The game takes place on a 10 by 10 grid, with each player choosing a race, then placing them at the relevant starting location (dependent on the number of players). Each player then takes it in turns to spawn units, take two actions for each unit (move, build or attack), constructing buildings that will either give them money (for building and upgrades), weapon tokens (for attacking and defending) for creating more units (for making actions). Players can build in an empty space, so long as they have the resources, however if the space has an enemy building, they can attack+build (redemption!) to create a building of one level higher than that attacked (for the cost of a lower level building). After each player has taken a turn, you roll for obstacles (Meteorites, etc) which can land anywhere and destroy buildings, whilst also being "Redeemed" by players to give them an easy higher level building.

Each race has their own goal, such as to own the majority of the board, along with a unique ability that aids them in this goal.

Once a player has reached this goal, they win the game after one more round.

Name: The Drowned Earth
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The Drowned Earth is a tabletop miniatures game where brave heroes and villains risk the dangers of the wilds for glorious riches and ancient technology!

Played on a 3ftx3ft table with 5-15 models a side, TDE is a game of dynamic movement, cinematic action and narrative gameplay, where risk vs reward must be weighed every turn.

At the heart of the game is the Dynamic Movement system, where models can leap, climb, jump off buildings and shoot while doing so!

A combination of cinematic action and an emphasis on named characters means that TDE has a very narrative feel: each game tells a story.

Name: Drizzit: Il gioco di carte – Personaggi e Poteri (più altre carte fichissime)
Description:
Expansion n. 2.5 for Drizzit: il gioco di carte.

It contains several cards that were previously released as print&play.

It includes:
3 new Characters with their Powers and Equipments,
7 alternative versions of previous Characters,
3 Muses,
2 Crystal cards,
5 alternative Bosses.

With this expansion, customers also obtain a booklet with strategic tips for the game and the first 80 strips of the comic, redrawed.

Name: Scuttle!: Promo Pack
Description: This 7-card promo pack includes Captain Bluebeard, Catbeard the Pirate, Firestarter Kelly, Jellybeans, La Capitán, Ninja, and the Vampirate.

Name: Napoleonic 20: Expansion Kit
Description:
The Napoleonic 20 Expansion Kit includes these new, optional Expansion Kit component modules:


     18 C'est la Guerre cards
     12 Maneuver Matrix cards and the "approach to battle" system
     8 Great Captains cards
     Chief-of-Staff system with new replacement Leader units
     ½ Morale Points system making this system realistically more granular
     Expanded Victory Conditions
     Strategic Pursuit system


Hanau 20 is a smaller, more "introductory" in size, game of the Napoleonic 20 series, which sees the curtain fall on the campaigns of 1813 as Napoleon was withdrawing from his defeat at the great Battle of Leipzig a fortnight earlier. Although it was not a large battle, it was a vital one, as Napoleon suddenly found his retreat route back to France blocked by an unexpected, newly raised Allied force.

Name: [dp6]
Description:
In a two-nation crewed submarine station, mysterious experiences became more and more frequent, until, in a fateful day, something terrible and powerful was discovered. With the outbreak of a world war on the surface, a sea-bottom race begins. But only one side can emerge.

[dp6] is a 2-player mini-game in which they try to reach the escape pod that will lead them to the surface, crossing 5 station rooms (tiles) that are blocked by coded doors (from 1 to 5). To open them, you got to tune these numbers through decoders represented by a d6.

Each player has 3 actions per turn, then the Freak do 2 actions based on AI.
The player’s actions can be: Move the meeples between the tiles, roll the dice to open or close the doors and move the pod, take tokens, use tokens to open or close doors automatically and to modify the dice results. 
The Freak’s action can be: Spawn, walk and eat a meeple.

Risk yourself to get into unknown chambers, utilize your limited resources to open the doors automatically or push your luck using the dice, reach for the escape pod before the unbeatable freak decimate all of your crew, or your rival reach the escape pod and leave you behind!

Name: Don't Poop on My Lawn
Description:
Object of the Game

The object of Don't Poop On My Lawn! is to be the first "neighbor" to lay out six grass cards and build a beautiful, "poop-free" lawn! The problem is the neighborhood is full of dogs and they're out to poop on your lawn!

Gameplay

Each player gets 7 cards and will play "Grass Cards" out in front of them to build their lawn.

To wander about the neighborhood you must play a "Walkies" card.  Below, the "doggie" is ready to head out into the neighborhood. Move your dog onto your neighbor's lawn to poop! Ready to poop? Take the "Poop Pile" and turn over cards one at a time until you get to a poop card! Count how many cards you turn over and place the same number of "poops" on their grass card! But wait! Sometimes its a false alarm! If you turn over a "Fart" card before you get to a "Poop" card, you don't get to poop at all!  (Fart Card = No poop!)

The game ends when a player lays out 6 grass cards that are completely poop free. That player is the winner of the game.

Name: Ant Colony
Description:
Ant Colony is a co-operative board game for ages 5+. The goal is to work together by placing tiles in a path that build an ant colony, while watching out for pesky anteaters, hidden rocks and angry beetles.  The tile based game requires light strategy and team communication.

The mission is to place the tiles on the board so that it includes a path with at least 2 unblocked entrances and all 4 of the Room tiles.

Spread all the tiles face down in a draw pile next to the game board. 
The Tunnel and Room tiles can only be played where all tunnels on the tile join when placed beside adjacent Tunnel tiles. There cannot be any Tunnel tiles that do not join a path, however the path can end next to an obstacle, like a beetle or rock.  Players take turns making decisions about where to place their tiles.

When all 4 Room tiles have been placed with 2 unblocked entrances, the task has been completed!

Name: Mosquito Madness
Description:
Mosquito Madness is a bug-slapping matching game.  Players frantically race to find the nine mosquitoes pictured on their card. The goal is to be the first to collect all your mosquitoes.

There are 72 mosquito discs for all players to see. Each player has a collecting board for the mosquitoes they need to find. Once all players turn over their collecting board, the madness begins as they frantically race to find their matching mosquitoes and slap the disc before another player grabs that mosquito.

The game is typically played in 5 rounds before declaring a winner.

Name: Animal Village
Description: Animal Village is a worker-placement style game played solely with cards in which players try to cultivate both crops and sheep to score points.

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Decks: The Land of Shadow
Description: 60 card pack of Nightmare Decks for the three scenarios contained in The Land of Shadow Saga Expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Wagon Wheels
Description:
Nanodaption of Circle the Wagons.


Description from the designer:

Based on Circle the Wagons by Stephen Aramini, Danny Devine, and Paul Kluka, as part of the April 2017 WGKS.

In the tiny wild west, you and an opponent circle your wagons around the board to score points for the cattle, guns, and forts. Each corner also has unique scoring conditions based on the locations of those items. Control a corner to score even more.

The largest nanodaption yet comes with 15 coins, and 2 2-sided cards for more options (or substitute pocket change).

Name: Vermin Vendetta
Description:
Vermin have invaded the backyard!

Choose different bug factions and battle it out to be the most adaptable bug in this backyard battlefield.

Each faction is trying to achieve a series of missions to become the victor in this deck building, tactical strategy game.  The factions all play different with variable powers and cards that other factions don't have access to.

You will be acquiring DNA to upgrade the cards you have access to, acquiring food to get more units out on the board, and destroying your opposition in the struggle for survival.

Name: Labyrinth Quest
Description:
A two player card game based on the Labyrinth movie.

There are 2 decks, one for each player: 
1. The Sarah Deck
2. The Goblin King Deck

Each card has a Strength value from 3 to 7. 
Each card has 1 or 2 Traits (Companion, Help, Action, Location,  Foe, Trick).  If a card has 2 traits the player must decide which one to use.

Game is played over a number of turns with each turn having 4 Phases:

Magic Phase
-  Each player fills their hand to 7 cards from their own deck.

Memory Phase
-  Each player may discard up to 4 cards and draw replacements.

Meld Phase
-  Each player makes a Meld. 
   -  For the Sarah player the Meld must have: 
      -  Up to 2 Companion cards
      -  Up to 2 Help cards
      -  Up to 2 Action cards
   -  For the Goblin King the Meld must have: 
      -  Up to 1 Location card
      -  Up to 3 Foe cards
      -  Up to 3 Trick cards
-  Players add up the Strengths of their Meld cards. The player with the higher Total Strength wins the hand. The Goblin King wins ties.

Mettle Phase
-  Discard all cards in play.

The first player to win 7 hands wins the game.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Hakflem Skuttlespike – Star Player
Description:
Hakflem Skuttlespike, the result of decades of unpleasant Skaven experiments, a player upon whose shoulders Clan Rigens immediately placed the future of the Skaven game of Blood Bowl. A petty, jealous and vicious example of Skaven cunning, he ensured that no other player would be created to rival him by killing any Clan Rigens experiment or creation that looked like a potential equal.

Now, given the sheer amount of time spent ensuring the demise of any Skaven who look able to rival him, you might think that Hakflem Skuttlespike neglects his duties on the hallowed Blood Bowl pitch. Not so! With this bizarre, two-headed resin kit, you can field him as a Star Player in any Skaven team you choose. Furious, muscular and bedecked with spiky bits, he is posed in an appropriately aggressive manner, both of his sharply toothed maws likely shrieking unintelligible threats at whichever poor opponent is in the way. Each of his four (count ‘em!) hands is ready to kill, with metal gloves and a spiked ball among the turmoil. There’s even space for some Skaven symbols on his armour.

This resin kit comprises 10 components, and includes two 32mm round bases, one featuring a hole to slot a ball into, indicating possession of the ball in your games of Blood Bowl.

Name: Are You An ALiEN?
Description:
‘Are You An ALiEN?’is a tactical question and answer card game, but don’t panic, it’s NOT a trivia quiz.

The earth is being invaded by ALiENs!
Not in a ‘Zap! Bang! Crash!’ way, but slowly and silently…
Unknown to most they are secretly replacing us with exact copies of the people we know.

NOW ANYONE COULD BE AN ALiEN!

Fortunately, it has become apparent that the copies take time to fully assimilate our thoughts and memories.
Following extensive background research and testimonies from family, friends and acquaintances the authorities have compiled a set of questions with verified responses designed to expose the galactic imposters.

Mr Doombar, Mrs Mayhem, Lord Uppercrust, Professor Banana, Lady Toff, Mrs Ditch, Doctor Butt, Harry, Otto, Norma and many others are all under suspicion.
Everyone will be asked one critical question - failure to respond with the established answer will reveal the ALiEN within!

‘Are You An ALiEN?’ is a card game for 2-6 players.
The deck is made up of 180 cards. On each turn players have a simple choice;- draw a number of cards from the deck or select a card belonging to another player and ask them a question.
As a human Subject suspected of being an ALiEN you must try to answer your question correctly.
However, you will also assume the role of an interrogation Agent with the 'ALiEN Imposter Detection Unit'.
In all, the cards feature over 300 different types of question and answer, after a quick look you will have to remember all the information on your drawn card(s) before placing them face-down in front of you. The more details you can remember the greater the chance of answering your question correctly.

Name: Quartz: Promo Pack 1
Description: On these promo pack you will find 3 pink Crystals, 5 new action cards and a small rulebook with 5 new variants to play Quartz.

Name: Pick a Brick
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Players take turns picking bricks and removing them from the wall. But be careful not to make the wall collapse as the nesting hen will tumble to the ground. Pick your brick wisely for if you choose the wrong brick and remove it too briskly the hen will fall and you will lose the game. Pick a Brick is a fun and smart game for all ages for 2-4 players.

Name: Throwdown!
Description:
Throwdown! is a great physical game for all the family! A quick, simple & fun game for 1-8 players, where the objective is to throw your cards into the specified area while, for example, jumping,  bending over or even  lying-down. Each card defines the points it is worth and the action needed.

The game can be played against a wall in the street or with an empty bin in the middle of the room!

What forefeit will the loser get and what does the winner get? It’s all up to you!

Name: Dungeon Dice: Boss Monsters
Description:
A set consisting of 8 boss monsters and 1 terrain die.

Boss monsters are legendary monsters that are not stored in the encounter bag.  Instead, they may be fought any time you wish if you are in the appropriate dungeon.  Boss monsters all provide a unique ring as a reward that is worth one fame.

Name: Kensei: The Awakening
Description:
Description from the publisher:

In this new edition of Kensei the game system has been simplified and livened up, creating new game mechanics that require continuous strategic planning. You will have no rest! Also, new troop profiles are available for clans and for the new undead army, as well as new rules for the use of magic and mythological creatures.

This edition has a long life ahead and we are already testing the rules for the new war machines which are arriving in this kickstarter campaign and many ideas to make you feel like you were playing in a really living world. Hymukai!.

Last but not least, the new system is standardized with Torii, the skirmish game set in the world of Kensei. Although they keep their different game dynamics we can create a whole experience, being able to play both large battles as small skirmishes, without having to learn to play two completely different games.

Name: Commies!
Description:
Commies! is a semi-cooperative 4-7 player card game in which each player controls a faction in the government and your ultimate goal is to amass enough supporters to seize power and all the riches that come with it. To do this, you must either form a coalition with 1-2 other players to stomp out the traitors, or you can scheme against everyone and seize power in the vacuum.

Each plot features five rounds, and during each round a faction plays one card face down, usually a power card featuring boots for Bolsheviks or fists for Mensheviks. One card is swept away into the State Secrets folder to be revealed at the end of the plot and the remaining cards are simultaneously revealed. After five rounds are completed, the State Secrets folder is opened and all cards are resolved. If boots outnumber fists, the Bolsheviks win the plot. If fists outnumber boots, then the Mensheviks win the plot. The losers forfeit their supporters to the corresponding winners in the tableau and another plot begins.

During the rounds, players may choose to play a leader card at any time to promote a player from the Mensheviks to the Bolsheviks. You can play a leader from your faction to increase your chances of being in the winning coalition, or you can play a leader from another faction giving players the chance to ruin the counter-revolutionary plots of their friends.

Commies! Will the Party Ever End?

Name: The Empire Legacy
Description:
Two players face off in an awesome duel as Empires that are trying to make each other fall.

Two teams of that included 5 champions of different kinds.

A Giant a dwarf, Mage Elf, And the Emperor fight, for what they think is right. Use different abilities and moves to destroy your enemy. Keep your champions hidden, so they can come in the best time possible.

Each team has 5 champions that they keep hidden to surprise there opponent in a bad situation

Kill your opponents Emperor first to win.

Name: Het Enige Echte en Ware Rondespel
Description:
This game is dedicated to the Tour of Flanders, one of the five one-day races known as cycling 'monuments'.
It's a dice game for up to 4 players with a twist.

The result of the die throw is read on the decagonal table at the center of the board. For certain throws players must advance not only their rider but another rider as well. There they have to decide if helping a rider ahead (and risking not seeing him again until the finish line) or a rider behind (and putting him back in the fight).
The board is divided in 8 sections, corresponding each to a well known section of the actual race (the short sharp climbs which have made this race famous) and some road crossings which may cause falls.
The player who crosses the finish line first with his rider wins the game.

The game comes with a large (70 x 50 cm) plastic board that is rolled inside a carboard tube.
Apart from the board the tube contains 4 small plastic riders, a D10 die and the rules in 4 languages (Dutch, French, English and German).

Name: Honest Rabbits
Description:
[Honest Rabbits] is the card games for Kids.

The most "honest" player can win a victory!
The winning strategy is to trust and to be trusted.

- Going to forward with Reliable friends!!!
With the simple rule, anybody are able to do this game easily. At first, you should try to align three cards in your hands with colors, number or in a row. You must get the forth card from another player. You can choose whom you trust to win together.

If anyone will achieve in the next turn, let you shout "I have that card!" regardless of whether you have it or not.

You are honest, aren't you?

Name: Legends of Rome
Description:
A card game for 2-6 Players themed around the History of Rome from its earliest Origins to the Fall of the West. Each player in turn takes control of the History of Rome.

There are 6 decks representing 6 consecutive ages, each played in turn: 
1.  Early Rome
2.  Early Republic
3.  Middle Republic
4.  Late Republic
5.  Empire
6.  Decline
Cards are of 11 different types: Leader, Threat, Conquest, Politics, Culture, Build, Religion, Disaster, Defect, Origin and Battle.

Players share common sets of Gold Coins, Ambition Tokens, Legion Markers, Fate Tokens, Faction Tokens, Threat Markers, Victory Tokens and Power Tokens.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 19 Phases:

-  Destiny Phase. Gain 1 Fate Token. 
-  Fate Phase. Flip over the top 2 cards from the current deck and place them face-up in their respective available card piles. If a card is an action card, place it in your hand. 
-  Ambition Phase. Gain 2 ambition tokens. 
-  Taxes Phase. Gain 1D6 gold plus 1 gold per conquest card you control. 
-  Disaster Phase. If there is a major disaster card available cause a target player to roll 3 times on the disaster table. If there is a Defect card available cause a target player to roll once on the disaster table.
-  Leader Phase. If a Leader card is available you may take it for 1 Fate token.  
-  Senate Phase. Discard a Politics card to gain one of a range of benefits.

-  Legion Phase. Pay 1 gold per Legion you control. You may raise extra Legions for 4 Gold each. 
-  Threat Phase. If there is a card in the Threat pile roll 1D6 and resolve.
-  Conquest Phase. If there are no cards in the Threat pile and there are one or more cards in the Conquest pile you may go conquering by paying 1 ambition token and 1 gold coin to attack one target conquest card in the conquest pile.
-  Politics Phase. If there are any Politics cards available, you may take all of them for 1 fate token.
-  Power Phase.  If you have a Leader that is not already in power, you may have him attempt to seize power by spending 3 ambition tokens and rolling 1D6 against a table and resolving.
-  Build Phase. If there are any Build cards available, you may purchase them for 1 ambition token and 4 gold each. Immediately gain 5VP. 
-  Religion Phase. If there are any Religion cards available, you may buy them for 1 gold each.  Immediately gain 2 VP for each. 
-  Culture Phase. If there are any Culture or Origin cards available, you may buy them for 1 fate token each. Immediately gain 1 VP for each Culture card and 3 VP for each Origin card. 
-  Games Phase. Spend 1 gold to roll on the games table and gain corresponding benefits.
-  Scoring Phase. Any player who has a Leader with a Power Token gets 1 VP and 1 Gold. The Player with the most Religion cards gets 1 VP. 
-  Corruption Phase. Discard Gold, Ambition, Legions, Fate and action cards down to their maximum permissible levels.
-  End Phase.  Roll 1D6 for each of your Leaders. On a roll of 6 a Leader is discarded.

An Age Ends when a turn starts and there are no cards left in the deck. All Leader and Origin cards controlled by players are discarded. All Available cards are discarded. 
Each player scores 1 VP for each Build card they control. The Player with the most Culture cards gets 10 VP. The Player with the least Culture cards loses 5 VP.  
Break out the deck for the next Age.

The game ends after the 6th Deck is used up. 
Final scoring takes place and the player with the most Victory Points wins.

Name: Mots Croisés Nathan
Description:
Loosely based on the game crosswords but this version is played with a fixed board and it doesn't involve rolling a cube, players pull word tiles from the box and then lay them on the board forming words to score points
The highest points scorer is the winner.

Name: Cards vs Dice: Strategically Evil
Description:
Two of the world's oldest game elements finally come together in simple and perfect chaos. From the makers of CARDS vs. DICE -CLASSIC- Strategically Lucky comes CARDS vs. DICE -DIABLO- Strategically Evil. A family card game for kids and adults.

CARDS vs. DICE - CLASSIC is all about collecting "LUCKY" cards. However, -DIABLO- works with "EVIL" cards which, by collecting, can lead to elimination.

The deck of cards is dealt evenly among all players. During each turn, players roll two dice, one red and one white. Players then try to match the dice with the cards in their hand. Depending on the exact dice roll and the cards played, players will either gain, give, or avoid an "EVIL" card. If a player acquires seven (7) "EVIL" cards, they are eliminated.

Win the game by ridding yourself of all the cards in your hand or by eliminating the other player(s) by giving them "EVIL" cards. Each game typically lasts 5 to 10 minutes. Prepare yourself to get strategically evil.

Name: Ski-Daddle
Description:
A ski race game for the fun of it!  A game of skill, steady hands, and fast competition.

2 Racing Slopes
2 Racing Balls

Object - To be the first player to roll his Racing Ball through the course.

Start - Each player selects a Slope and Ball. The balls are placed in the number 1 holes on each Slope. The race begins.

Race Procedure - Each player flips his ball into the air and catches it on the Slope. The Ball is then rolled over the Slope to Hole #2. From there is is rolled to Holes #3 and #4. The first player to reach Hole #4 wins.

Hands - A player may reposition his hand(s) at any time during the race. However at no time can the Ball touch a hand. If this occurs the Ball must be placed in the last corner hole reached before the player can continue.

If Ball Falls Off Slope - If the Ball falls through a hole or off the Slope it must be returned to the last corner hole occupied. For example, if the Ball falls off the Slope while on its way from Hole #3 to Hole #4 it must be placed back in #3 before the player can proceed. The Ball must come to a complete rest in each corner hole before it can be flipped out.

Course - A player does not have to follow a prescribed course. He may flip, bounce or roll the Ball between corners in any manner that suits his temperament.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Death Zone – Season Two
Description:
Greetings, sports fans, and welcome to a smashing new season of Blood Bowl! In this 80-page softback book, you’ll find a host of new content with which to expand and enhance your games – new rules, new teams, new Star Players, new Hall of Fame entries – there’s a lot of new stuff to get your teeth into.

In the book

In Blood Bowl Death Zone Season Two you’ll find:

- New teams! Included are rules for Underworld Denizens, Goblins and Chaos Renegades
- 12 Star Players – Dwarf, Skaven, Dark Elf, High Elf, Wood Elf, Amazon, Human, Halfling, Lizardmen, Vampire, Goblin, Chaos Renegade and Norse teams are covered – with background, new artwork and rules for use in games;
- New optional rules! Do you want to keep a Star Player in your team for a while? Now you can have them stick around for a much-needed boost. Running short on gold? Sponsorship deals can help out, if you don’t mind swallowing your pride and shilling McNurty’s Burger Emporium. Looking for a stadium residency? Make enough gold and you can buy your own!
- Rules for well-known referees and coaching staff, with their own quirks and specialities, and rules for different stadium and pitch types;
- History and team rosters for 6 new Hall of Fame entries – The Warpfire Wanderers, The Greenboyz, The Grudgebearers, The Celestial Comets, Chaos All-Stars and The Underworld Creepers;
- The Official Blood Bowl reference guide – an up-to-date summary of available teams, and a Skills Update featuring some corrections, clarifications and new skills following feedback from the Blood Bowl community;
- A ton of all-new background content detailing key teams, players and events in the history of Blood Bowl; facts and figures that every fan needs to know.

Name: Great War at Sea: Turkish Black Sea Fleet
Description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In May 1918, German troops occupied Sevastopol, base of the Russian Black Sea Fleet. All of the Central Powers – even the Bulgarians – made claims on at least some of the ships of the Black Sea Fleet as war reparations, as did the newly-independent Ukraine. The German Navy intended to man the best ships with Turkish crews backed by German "advisors" and send them to protect the Dardanelles. Only one ship, the dreadnought Volya, would ever sail under a Central Powers flag (on a single test cruise with a German crew), but the Allies fretted over the appearance of the former Russian ships outside the Turkish Straits.

The New Year's 2014 Golden Journal includes 25 new laser-cut, mounted, scorchless and sootless pieces for the Turkish Black Sea Fleet: 15 "long" ship pieces, 9 square ones, and a seaplane. And we have some scenarios for them, too.
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Great War at Sea: Spoils of Victory
Description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

At the end of the Great War, the German High Seas Fleet was interned at Scapa Flow at the northern tip of Scotland as a guarantee of the November 11th Armistice. Within weeks, French leaders were demanding that at least a portion of the ships, if not all of them, be handed over to France as compensation for the destruction wrought on French soil during the war. The discussions came to an end in June 1919, when the German sailors still aboard the ships scuttled them rather than see them flying enemy flags or worse, displayed in victory celebrations.

Victoire is a variant for U.S. Navy Plan Gold, in which the French have successfully received the most extreme of their demands: all of the most modern German battleships, battle cruisers and light cruisers. Newly refitted and ready for action, these vessels join the French fleet projecting the Republic’s naval power into the Caribbean basin. With the addition of 14 formerly German dreadnoughts and six cruisers, the Marine Nationale is now a match for the U.S. Navy. The Monroe Doctrine is about to become a dead letter.

The Harvest 2015 Golden Journal includes twenty new laser-cut, mounted pieces depicting these ships in Great War at Sea format. They bear French livery and new names, and revised artwork. It’s a good-looking set. Plus you get scenarios for their use.
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Second World War at Sea: FDR's Lost Ships of 1937
Description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In 1937, President Franklin Roosevelt cut defense spending in response to the demands of Republicans and conservative Democrats for a balanced budget, even as unemployment continued to soar. Had he continued with his use of naval construction as a jobs program, the U.S. Navy would have had a number of additional heavy warships in 1941: two battleships, two carriers and their aircraft, and additional cruisers and destroyers.

The Midsummer 2014 Golden Journal includes 25 new laser-cut, mounted, scorchless and sootless pieces for FDR's Lost Ships of 1937: 15 "long" ship pieces and 10 aircraft pieces. And we have some scenarios for them, too.
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Second World War at Sea: Poland's Fantasy Fleet
Description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Poland's Fantasy Fleet gives you the fleet the Polish admirals hoped to build in the 1930's, with battle cruisers, heavy cruisers, light cruisers and large destroyers. Seemingly an insane proposition, the fleet had a very real purpose: to secure the lower reaches of the Baltic Sea in the event of a war between Poland and the Soviet Union in which Germany remained neutral while Britain and France provided materiel and supplies but did not commit their own naval forces to keeping the sea lanes open. That seemed the most likely scenario for a future war, and a strong Polish Navy would be vital to victory.

There are 20 one-inch-long Polish ship pieces included. And you even get a couple of scenarios for Second World War at Sea: Sea of Iron to study this Polish war plan.
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Second World War at Sea: Finland's Fantasy Fleet
Description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

The Finns relied on large-caliber coast-defense guns to protect their long, rocky coastline with its countless small islands and skerries: over 1,200 kilometers’ worth. To support the powerful but immobile big guns, Finnish strategy called for small, armored coast-defense ships that could slip between the islands and torpedo-armed ships to dart out and sink attacking enemy warships.

That never came to pass: the Finns built two top-heavy armored gunboats which they called “battleships,” but never funded the third member of the class. A handful of motor torpedo boats would be fielded during the Second World War, but plans to build or buy a group of six small destroyers repeatedly failed to win Parliamentary approval.

The Daylight Savings 2017 Golden Journal comes with 20 new laser-cut and mounted playing pieces representing Finland's Fantasy Fleet composed of these new ships, plus a couple of new Sea of Iron scenarios for their use.
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Galaxy of Trian: Epic Conflict
Description:
The new expansion of "Galaxy of Trian: New Order" announced on kickstarter campaign.

The expansion includes new tiles, more crystals and introduced two card decks:

Destiny deck contains destination cards, artifact cards and tiles with artifact markers. Artifact cars include technological gadgets and unique ancient technology. Destination cards will give new end triggers.

Battle deck gives you the opportunity to use special actions and gain extra combat bonus.

Additionally, this expansion gives the chance to add two players, so it's possible to play with 2-6 players. If the expansion is used twice, it will be possible to play the game for 2-8 players.

Name: Destination: Neptune (Second Edition)
Description:
While bearing the label "Second Edition", Destination: Neptune (Second Edition) is actually an expansion for Destination: Neptune as it contains only the material needed to play the most recent version of the game, with components from the base game being required as well. This second edition plays more quickly, is easier to learn, and is much better for two players (compared to the first edition). However, the reward for being grounded in science is still at the core of the game!

The new attribute cards vary each game, and the rules also provide a number of options for varying the games even more!

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): The Scarcrag Snivellers – Goblin Blood Bowl Team
Description:
The Scarcrag Snivellers made a decision a long time ago to make an attempt at playing Blood Bowl without all the sneaky tricks employed by most Goblin teams. Eleven Goblins line up at the start of the match – no Trolls, no Secret Weapons – and do their very best to last at least a couple of drives before they’re stomped into the ground. Bizarrely, this doesn’t always end as badly for them as it probably should, and somehow the Scarcrag Snivellers seem to make it from season to season without being utterly wiped out…

Pick up a Goblin team for your games of Blood Bowl with this set of plastic miniatures. In it, you’ll find 12 multi-part Goblins, featuring 6 pairs of unique bodies and 7 pairs of unique heads, meaning no two Goblin teams need look alike! There are also 6 Goblin team balls, featuring the kind of dirty tricks the Scarcrag Snivellers frown upon – 2 deflated, 2 with Goblins stuck in them and 2 stuffed with dynamite – 2 turn counters and 2 double-sided team tokens. The 54-component kit is supplied with 12 32mm Blood Bowl bases and a 1,000,000 gold piece roster, including 8 (eight!) team re-rolls and Fan Factor 4!

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Blood Bowl Goblins
Description:
They might not have any specialists, they might not be hulking great slabs of powerful muscle, but one thing Goblins are is numerous. Expand your own team of Blood Bowl Goblins with this set of 4 multi-part plastic miniatures!

You’ll get 4 unique bodies, with 4 unique heads to attach to them, meaning you can mix and match them to your heart’s delight. Included is a special Goblin team ball, featuring a plucky Goblin who has become temporarily indisposed (stuck. He’s stuck in the ball.)

This kit comprises 15 components, and includes 4 32mm Blood Bowl bases

Name: Mit Galileo um die Welt
Description:
In this game, players follow tv-reporters from the show "Galileo" on their journey around the world. 
In different sectors, players have to estimate about special behaviours in different countries (like How long is the rollercoaster ride in a certain holiday park in the netherlands or "how many liters of icecream eat germans within a whole year?") and with some luck and skills, they can put the nations flags on their suitcases.

Dices are included and will determine, which questions you have to answer.

Name: The Media Game
Description:
The Media Game was inspired by Careers and was designed by the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) as a teaching tool for their National Spot Sales department.

The object of the game is to earn the greatest number of Market Share Units and Media Efficiency Units by going through various "clients".  At the end of the game the player who has the greatest number of Units and Profits will be the winner of the game.

Players move around the board by the value of one of two dice (player's choice). Depending on which square they land on, they will either receive 'credits' or 'penalties'. There are three types of "units" a player can gain points in and a player scores their lowest of these three, so they must try to maximize each unit type equally in order to win. Random effects through the drawing of event cards will also occur. While each player has little control over which credits and penalties they receive in the game, the overall purpose of The Media Game is educational. It was designed for employees of the CBC Sales department as a way to make them familiar with company terminology, policies, and marketing strategies.

Name: Extractors!
Description:
From the publisher: 

Doriana, a Sol-like star system in the Sagittarius arm. Doriana-5, a medium sized planet barely suitable to life, is inhabited by bipedal intelligent creatures, organized in "hives". Not as curious as us, their evolution has been slow, but they have now reached a technology level high enough to put a halt on the centuries-aged wars between hives. Dorians became aware that continuing these wars with weapons more and more deadly would lead to mutual extinction....

5 light-years away, the Avronians develop the ability to send non-living materials through space at effective speed faster than light. Carbophosphate composites, the main organic energy source on Avronia, has now become very scarce but, according to recent probe reports, it is common on Doriana-5.

Whilst most of the Avronian masters are still debating the best way to negotiate their energy crisis, groups of desperate peoples decide to send armed forces (huge semi-autonomous machines) to secure large extraction perimeters on Doriana-5....

Extractors is a two-player game of medium complexity and medium solitaire suitability. One player controls a company of the Dorian Cellular Forces, consisting of Augmented Infantry Sections organized in cells and support vehicles. They face Avronian Machines whose AI is represented by the second player.

Contains a rule book, playing surface, a sheet of die-cut mounted counters, and a sheet of tables.

Name: Saboteur: Map Swap
Description:
Saboteur: Map Swap is a single card expansion for Saboteur distributed during the 2017 Saboteur World Championship. If the basic game is used, the promo card replaces one copy of the „Map Card“ type.

The card is played from the hand of one of the players, just like any other action card. The player playing this card can swap two different goal cards – without looking at them.

The procedure is as follows (after the player played the card):

1. Player chooses two face-down lying goal cards (without looking at them)
2. (S)he shuffles those two cards face-down -> if the player is actually swapping them is up to the player
3. The player puts back those cards, swapped or unswapped

Name: Star Wars Spin
Description:
A star wars dexterity game. It contains 20 miniatures of star wars with a special round base, called Rollinz.
It has two mode of plays. In the first one players take turns spinning their miniatures in the circular board in the back of the box and the most points win. It can also be played solitaire against your own high score. 
On the second one players try to hit the minis of other players. If they hit them then the other player lost that mini, but if they dont hit anything, then they lost the mini used in the shoot, so the game is quickly over (every round are mini lost)

Name: Halmstad: Spelet om din stad
Description:
Part of the "Spelet om din stad" series about Swedish cities.
The game is kind of monopoly, with minor rule variations, located in Halmstad.
Release 2007 during Halmstads 700 year anniversary.

Name: Wager of the Gods: Hades vs. Poseidon
Description:
In the timeless realm of the Greek gods, Zeus reigns supreme. His resentful brothers, Hades and Poseidon, often find themselves bored, and squabble about their lesser status. To settle matters, albeit temporarily, they occasionally wager on events in the human sphere. On this day, they’re betting for boasting rights on three separate races: a Greek chariot race c. 350 BC, a trail run in present-day Idaho, USA, and a space-faring contest at light-speed in the year 4017. Naturally, the sneaky duo will try to influence the outcome of the contests, while Zeus keeps a watchful eye on their activities.

Wager of the Gods is unique in that players will simultaneously need to manage three distinct races, each with its own rigors and pitfalls. Movement is generated by multi-numbered chit draw; these numbers must be allocated to each of the three game boards. Naturally there are occasional special actions -- and just the right amount of strategy for a tense and fun two-player game. The player who wins two of the three races wins the day!

Components:

•  3 Game Boards
• 70 Action Counters
•  6 Player Tokens in two colors
•  4 Galaxy Counters
•  8 Whip Counters
•  6 Ram Counters
•  1 Dolphin Counter 
•  2 Reference Cards

Name: Turn
Description:
2 players Dark and Light

Materials
8x8 checkerboard
56 bi-color pieces
A supply of plastic rings

Object
The game ends with victory for the first player that makes a four in a row; consisting of friendly ringed or non-ringed pieces that are orthogonally or diagonally adjacent. Otherwise, the player still able to move is the winner.

Setup
Stack the 56 pieces on the border spaces in an alternating pattern of black and white. There should be face-up a black-sided piece and a white-sided piece per space.

Play
One player plays black the other white, both share the plastic rings.

Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn,
1) Move a "naked" friendly piece across empty squares in a straight orthogonal line from the border onto an empty square or
2) Move a "naked" friendly piece in a straight orthogonal line, moving over no more than one enemy piece and no further than the empty square behind that jumped piece. The moving piece must end up with at least one orthogonal or diagonal neighbor. You can optionally flip the piece just moved to your opponent’s color and then place a plastic ring over the piece, making it permanent. Once this happens, any orthogonally or diagonally adjacent "naked" pieces are also flipped.

Restrictions
A player may not repeat the board position of the previous turn.

Name: Spring Coming Baseball
Description:
Spring Coming Baseball is a fast play statistical replay game by Roberto Chiavini (but not so fast, as you roll for each inning for each team, to get the number of hits and run for each inning), with individual yearbook for a huge plethora of leagues.

Teams are rated for Offense and Defense, and the total of the two ratings are combined to highlight a column on the Hits grid.  A roll of two six sided dice, potentially modified by a roll of the ten sided "Third Die", produces a number of hits for the half inning being played.

Then, for each hit, a percentile roll versus the batting team's Conversion Percentage is made determining whether that hit produces a run.

Repeating this process for each half inning, individual games can be played in minutes, and seasons (or post-seasons) in a single sitting.

The basic game comes with a rulebook and the 12 seasons of the All American Girls League, 1943-54.

As well as the complete history of both the National and American Major Leagues, the following yearbooks are also available: 
American Association, 1946, 1947 and 1948
Big South League 1996 and 1997
Canadian Baseball League 2003
Dixie Association 1971
Federal League 1914 and 1915
Inter American League 1979
International League 1965 and 1966
Lone Star League 1977
Mexican League 1955
National Association 1871, 1872, 1873, 1874 and 1875
North American League 2011 and 2012
Pacific Coast League 1952, 1953, 1954, 1955, 1956 and 1957
Pecos League 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2016
South Atlantic League 1963
South Coast League 2007
Texas League 1950, 1951 and 1952

Name: EQUAL
Description:
EQUAL is a quick mathematical challenge between 2 players using just a standard deck of cards (and 2 dice).

By combining cards, players attempt to form a calculation to equal, or get the closest possible to, a randomly generated target number.
Drawing additional cards may help but, the more cards a player takes, the more they have to give to their opponent.

The rules are just a single page.

EQUAL was an entry in the 2017 Two-Player Print and Play Game Design Contest

Name: Colonnade
Description:
Colonnade is a column building game that uses just a standard deck of cards and 6 dice.

Players add cards to a 6 column Colonnade according to the dice they roll. You gain control of a column by placing more cards on it than your opponent.
And you can push your luck for better dice combos that will give a greater choice of ways to play your cards.

The player who controls the majority of columns at the end of the game wins.

The rules are on just one sheet of paper and include examples of play.

Colonnade was an entry in the 2017 Two-Player Print and Play Game Design Contest

Name: Sleepy Troll
Description:
Don't let Troll's adorableness fool you; those clawed hands are for more than just clutching his teddy bear. As a thief, pillage the beast's den and steal as much of his gold as possible before he wakes. Troll's hoard holds treasure enough to make even paupers into kings. 
But be careful, should he catch you carrying away his hard-stolen riches...Well, Sleepy Trolls also make terrifying Angry Trolls.

This light, press your luck game pits player against player as they attempt to steal the sleeping troll's gold. The game begins with one player drawing cards from a single, 99 card deck in the center of the table. He or she may grab any number of cards, but if an Angry Troll cards is pulled, he or she loses all of the drawn cards from that turn. Angry Troll Cards may be mitigated by one of the limited Sword and Shield Cards in the deck. Players may also steal from their fellow players using special action cards.

The game ends when players have gone through the entire deck. The player with the most amount of gold claims victory.

Name: 66D6
Description:
The boardgame 66d6 is a two-player tactical game with simple rules and lots of dice. Easy to learn, hard to master.

Players both have an army of 33 minions (dice) at their disposal, to take to battle with the enemy forces.

Dice rolls determine composition of your army. How you use your army is up to the player. There are no bad rolls; merely changing tactics.

Name: Adamastor: The Sea Monster
Description:
ADAMASTOR is a Whimsical Competitive Boardgame of horrible sea monsters that live in the depths of the sea, where the Atlantic meets the Indian Ocean, fighting amongst each other to be the one that gets to skink the very unfortunate ships that atempt to cross the Cape of Torments.

---

The game of ADAMASTOR is played with 2 to 4 players. Each game lasts 5 rounds (6 with 2 players), at the end of which the
player with the most total of Victory points (VP) is the winner of the game.

Each player controls one sea monster. Players use simultaneous card play to move their monsters on the
board and attack ships and other player’s monsters. The cards chosen cards also determine the turn order (the better the actions, the slower you are). Players score victory points either by sinking the Portuguese
fleet or by knocking down other sea Monsters or by completing variable objectives that make each game feel different. At the end of each round players will each choose and gain a new action card that provides them with better Monster Actions for the following rounds.

---

Adamastor is a card-driven simultaneous action selection game with fast paced mechanic and a modular board that keeps every game fun and fresh.

Name: Peixes
Description:
The water is dirty in the center of the lake complex. So, the fishes must find their way to the other lakes in the extremities of the lake complex. There, they will have pure water and a peaceful time.

Each player controls a quantity of fishes. He must change the spaces on the board to create a way straight to a clean lake. As more tiles the way have, as more it changes the lake itself.

Name: Shit for Brains
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Shit For Brains was borne out of a love for bar trivia and a hate for boring facts. Frustrated with questions about Presidents (but not about naked Presidents), and rivers (but not about rivers catching on fire), and animals (but not about weirdly-shaped animal penises), we decided to make a game for people like us. It's a game full of hilarious, morbid, irreverent, outrageous, disgusting, ironic, awesome, pathetic, twisted, and downright weird trivia. Each SFB box comes with 600 cards (6 categories with 100 cards each), a timer, die, and a whole lot of love and bad jokes.

The gameplay is incredibly simple- a team/player rolls the die, and then is asked a question from the corresponding deck. If they answer correctly, they keep the card and roll again. If they get it wrong, it's the next person/team's turn. First team to get one card in each category is the winner! Easy, right?

The starter set comes with the following categories:


     Bodily Functions 
     Crime & Death 
     Drugs, Man 
     'Merica 
     Nature Calls 
     Sexy Time

Name: KhromaZones
Description:
KhromaZones is a quick, family-friendly game that plays competitively, cooperatively or solo, where you use colorful gemstone cards to claim zones and score points.

Each player uses  their hand of colorful cards to claim zones and score points. The more claimed zones in a row, the more points. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: On Your Mark!
Description:
On Your Mark!: The Art of Sketching and Guessing Card Game

On your mark, get set, draw! Whether you’re great at drawing or not, you’ll sketch your way to laughter in this creative party game! Start by sketching a secret word or phrase on your canvas card. The twist is that your card already has a mark on it that must be incorporated into your drawing. Score points by guessing other players’ secret words. The player with the most correct guesses wins. It’s hours of fun and might even be your 15 minutes of fame.

Card game includes: 150 TITLE Cards, 150 CANVAS Cards, 8 dry erase markers, 8 card stands, 8 score sheets, 2 erasers and an instruction sheet.
    For ages 10+.
    For 2-8 players.
    Game lasts approximately 30 minutes.
    9.5" W x 2.75" H x 4.5" D

Name: The Guvnor
Description:
OVERVIEW
The GUVNOR is a gangster themed card trading game. Players trade crime cards simultaneously in order to gain RESPECT from the other players. The first player to win 30 RESPECT points wins the game.

GAMEPLAY
Players are dealt nine random CRIME cards at the start of the game and seven REPECT points. The dealer starts the trading by shouting 'LET'S DO BUSINESS' after which all players may trade cards face down across the table. The first player to collect nine identical CRIME cards shouts 'AVE SOME OF THAT!' to win the round. The winner of the round becomes The GUVNOR and receives a win bonus (PROFIT). All the other players then pay The GUVNOR one RESPECT point from their pile. Any players caught RED HANDED (i.e. they have six or more identical CRIME cards in their hand) pay a penalty. The GUVNOR then takes a DECREE card from a wild deck - it may effect them directly or it may be used to hindered/help another player. The CRIME cards are then returned, shuffled and the next round begins.

Name: ACNOS
Description:
ACNOS: acknowledge the potential

ACNOS is a competitive abstract strategy game for two players. In ACNOS, players manipulate armies of shapes within a standard 8x8 chessboard with a win condition of either capturing the opponent’s treasure square, or depriving the opponent of a legal move.

There are 24 pieces per side in ACNOS, each of which has unique move sets determined by the arrows shown on their face. Throughout the game, pieces get placed on the board, moved according to their arrows, flipped to produce mirror images, rotated in multiples of 90 degrees, or merged to create more powerful shapes. During setup, players secretly choose a treasure square and 8 pieces to surround it. Each turn, players choose to activate one of three abilities (place a new piece on the board under your control, build a blockade to remove a square from the board, or declare a merge between two pieces to make a stack), then choose two different pieces under their control and move them. Initially, pieces are limited to 2 shapes per merge stack, but when a piece makes it to the other side of the board, it can teleport home by moving off the opponents back rank, thereby deepening its merge potential by one extra piece.

ACNOS is extremely complex (over 10^35 legal setups, 36 million possible states per square, over 200 thousand legal first moves on average), and rewards deep strategic thinking, careful planning, and tactical calculations. Acknowledge the potential, and capture your opponent’s treasure! NOTE: For casual play, reserve pieces are drawn randomly from a bag, with each “next piece” being public information. For tournaments, players determine the order of reserve pieces during setup phase, and the entire order becomes public information when the veil is lifted.

Name: The Bulldog Game
Description: The Bulldog Game is a spin & move game of collecting bones for 2-4 players.  It is labeled as "A child's first strategy game" for ages 5-9.

Name: SHRINE
Description:
SHRINE: Completion

SHRINE is a competitive abstract strategy game, where two players take turns placing stones on a beautiful board of tiled pentacles. The stones and the pentacles each come in three colors: crimson, cream, and cobalt. Stone placement follows this order, and players take turns placing the next color of stone on the board. There are only two rules to placement: no stone may be placed on a pentacle of its own color, and no two stones of the same color may be placed next to one another.

Stones on pentacles sharing an interface are connected. Connected stones, enclosing at least one pentacle, are a loop. A loop that encloses at least one pentacle of each color is a shrine. The player to complete the first shrine wins the game.

Shrine is distinct from classic stone-placing games in that players become decoupled from colors. A winning structure will usually include stones laid by both players, but the winner is the one who places the final stone. This leads to an interesting dilemma: how much do I cooperate with my opponent to build this shrine?

Name: Fact or Crap: Hollywood
Description:
From the Publisher:

We’ve dug up the dirt on Hollywood! Fact or Crap Celebrity Edition lets you uncover the outrageous truth about Who’s Who in Hollywood by asking the only question that counts: Is it Fact, or Crap? In this fast-paced trivia game, your aim is to wow the opposition with how much you know about Hollywood celebrities and their paparazzi-filled world. Get to the truth of it all with Fact or Crap Celebrity Edition!

Features

Uncover the outrageous truth about Who’s Who in Hollywood by asking the only question that counts: Is it Fact, or Crap?
Answer correctly, and you'll win tokens. Choose the wrong answer, and give up a token! The players with the most tokens at the end wins!
Includes Rush Hour cards: Answer quickly to win the most tokens possible!
Fact or Crap Celebrity Edition has tons of celebrity trivia with attitude and is made for 3-8 adult players.

Name: Explorers of the North Sea: Rocks of Ruin
Description:
In Explorers of the North Sea: Rocks of Ruin, new opportunities await daring captains. Recent storms have left longships torn apart, with their precious cargo scattered across the rocky shores. Meanwhile, rumors of great fortresses in nearby regions are beginning to spread. Will you be the first to salvage the wrecks, or will you throw caution to the wind and charge the enemy fortresses for fame and glory?

In addition to including components for an extra player, Rocks of Ruin also includes three new building types, 24 tiles, five large player boards, two new captain cards, shipwrecks and fortresses.

—description from the publisher

Also contains "The North Sea Runesaga: Fifth Player Expansion".
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Feudalia: Palace Intrigues Expansion
Description: The Palace Intrigues Expansion is a set of 64 new cards to add more interaction between the players. The expansion includes new characters, such as the Student, the Wise Man or the Minstrel.

Name: La Cueva Mágica
Description:
Once upon a time, Ali Baba, a poor lumberjack from Persia, discovered a hidden treasure belonging to a forty thieves gang. Emeralds, diamonds, rubies, precious objects… GOLD! All was hidden in a cave which was open and sealed magically. To open the cave they prounounced the words “Open Sesame!” and, to seal it, “Close sesame!”. While the greedy thieves were out, Ali Baba entered the caved and took some of their treasures. Ali Baba’s brother’s Cassim, dishonest and usurer, discovered the sudden wealth of his sibling and followed him to the cave, where he entered unseen. Fooled by his own greed and excitement to so many treasures, Cassim forgot the magic words and was found by the thieves, who carved him up due to his temerity. Now you will play as Ali and Cassim and, with your loyal servant Moxana’s help, will get the highest number of treasures in The Magic Cave without being noticed by the Forty Thieves.

Take all the components from the box and leave the box in the center of the table. Put inside the box all 20 small treasure cards and close it. Place uniformally all 40 big treasure cards surrounding the game box. Deal to each player 1 character card, 2 Moxana cards of the same color and 3 carrots to each player. The 20 treasure tokens have the same treasure pictures as the 40 large tokens. On the small tokens there is a treasure on each side; on the large tokens there is a treasure on one side and the drawing of a thief on the other.

At the beginning of each round one player has the open box at least 5 seconds (min), and next he close the box. The box does not reopen until the end of the round. In your turn, you can play as Ali (picking up as much large treasures as pointing to the dice, treasures that have to be visible face up inside the box). If you are wrong, you will deduct points. If you don't remember more of the treasures that are in the box face up, you play as Cassim. Cassim flips the big treasures to hinder the other players. If you play as Cassim, you can't play as Ali until the next round. The round ends when everyone has played as Cassim. Successful and failed treasures are checked.

Treasures and special characters help the players to get more points or subtracting rival's points.

After 4 rounds, the player who earns more points with the treasures wins.


Cuenta la historia que Alí Babá, un pobre leñador de Persia, descubre el tesoro oculto de una banda de 40 ladrones. Esmeraldas, diamantes, rubies, objetos preciados,...¡ORO!, todo lo esconden en una cueva que abren y cierran mágicamente. Para abrir la cueva pronuncian las  palabras “Ábrete, Sésamo!”, y para cerrarla, “¡Ciérrate, Sésamo!  En ausencia de los ávaros ladrones, Alí Babá entra en la cueva mágica y se lleva algunos tesoros.
Cassim, el hermano deshonesto y usurero de Alí Babá, descubre la repentina riqueza de su hermano y lo sigue hasta la cueva, en la que entra a escondidas. En su codicia y nerviosismo ante tantos tesoros, Cassim olvida las palabras mágicas y los ladrones lo encuentran y lo descuartizan por su osadía. Ponte en la piel de Ali y Cassim y, con la ayuda de la leal sierva Moxana, consigue el mayor número de tesoros de La Cueva Mágica sin alertar a los 40 ladrones.

Saca todos los componentes de la caja y colocar ésta en el centro de la mesa. Introduce en la caja las 20 fichas de tesoro pequeñas y ciérrala. Coloca las 40 fichas de tesoro grandes alrededor de la caja del juego, repartidas de forma homogénea. Reparte una ficha de personaje a cada jugador, dos fichas de Moxana del mismo color y 3 zanahorias. Las 20 fichas de tesoro tienen los mismos dibujos de tesoro que hay en las 40 fichas grandes. En las fichas pequeñas hay un tesoro en cada lado, en las fichas grandes hay un tesoro por un lado y el dibujo de un ladrón por el otro.

Hay 4 rondas. Al principio de la ronda un jugador tendrá la caja abierta mínimo 5 segundos. La caja no se volverá a abrir hasta el final de la ronda. Por turnos, los jugadores jugarán como Alí (cogiendo tanto tesoros como indique el dado, tesoros que tienen que estár visibles boca arriba dentro de la caja), si se confunde restará puntos. Si no se acuerdan de los tesoros que hay en la caja boca arriba, los jugadores juegan como Cassim. Cassim da la vuelta a los tesoros grandes para molestar a los otros jugadores.
